topic.title: Indexes
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server indexes enhance the performance of query and search operations.

section.title: Indexes
section.p: The following forms of index are available:

ul.li: Primary: Provided by the Index Service, this provides an index based on on the unique key of every item in a specified bucket. Every primary index is maintained asynchronously. A primary index is intended to be used for simple queries, which have no filters or predicates.

Secondary: Provided by the Index Service, this provides an index on a key within a document. The value associated with the key can be of any type: scalar, object, or array.
A secondary index is frequently referred to as a Global Secondary Index, or GSI. This is the kind of index used most frequently in Couchbase Server, for queries performed with the N1Ql query-language. GSIs are also used by the Analytics service.

Full Text: Provided by the Search Service, this provides a specially purposed index, which contains targets whose values are derived from textual and other contents of documents within one or more specified buckets. Text-matches of different degrees of exactitude can be sought for. Both input and target text-values can be purged on irrelevant characters (such as punctuation marks or html tags).
